hypothesis_content.title: Liquidity Gap Reversal After Stress Events
hypothesis_content.statement: Following a sharp liquidity withdrawal event (≥15% drop in aggregate order book depth), BTC will experience a mean-reverting bounce of 3-5% within 48 hours as market makers reload inventory at discounted prices.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Market makers and algorithmic traders systematically reload inventory after forced deleveraging events. The October liquidity crash created structural gaps that institutional players exploit. Negative funding rates provide carry incentive for long positions.
entry_conditions: BTC 24h order book depth (sum of top 10 bids/asks across 5 major exchanges) drops ≥15% from 7-day average
BTC price drops ≥2% on the same day as liquidity withdrawal
Funding rates turn negative (≤ -0.01% per 8h) on perpetual futures
Volume-weighted spread (1% depth) widens to ≥1.5x 7-day average
hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If liquidity withdrawal continues for >72 hours without reversal, or if price continues dropping despite negative funding rates persisting beyond 3 funding periods.
